remarks: The inverse of a subgroup element is the same as its inverse in the parent group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Jul-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
subgoinv.1 $e |- W = ran H $.
subgoinv.2 $e |- M = ( inv ` G ) $.
subgoinv.3 $e |- N = ( inv ` H ) $.
subgoinv $p |- ( ( H e. ( SubGrpOp ` G ) /\ A e. W ) -> ( N ` A ) = ( M ` A ) ) $.
